oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Engraving of Lt. Robert Gates, CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Engraving of Lt. Robert Gates, Co. H, 6th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, by H. H. Halls & Sons of N. Y. for Lindsley's Historical Series. Gates enlisted as a private in 1861, and rose to the rank of captain. Much of his service was as a staff officer. After the war, he wrote a history of the 6th Tenn. Inf. Regt. for the Military Annals of Tennessee, Confederate. He made and lost a fortune in railroads, then became a journalist, and later a commissioner of the Louisville and Nashville railroad.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gates, Robert
